abstract: Under its latest proposal to Yahoo, Microsoft would buy its search business and take a stake in the company, people briefed on the negotiations said Monday.
snippet: Under its latest proposal to Yahoo, Microsoft would buy its search business and take a stake in the company, people briefed on the negotiations said Monday.
lead_paragraph: Under its latest proposal to Yahoo, Microsoft would buy its search business and take a stake in the company, people briefed on the negotiations said Monday.

headline.main: Details of Microsoft Offer to Yahoo
headline.print_headline: Details of Microsoft Offer to Yahoo

abstract: Fighting Google, Microsoft has approached Yahoo with a narrower aim: a collaboration on Internet advertising.
snippet: Fighting Google, Microsoft has approached Yahoo with a narrower aim: a collaboration on Internet advertising.
lead_paragraph: Two weeks after walking away from takeover talks with Yahoo, Microsoft has made it clear that it still needs to create an Internet powerhouse that could rival Google  and that its interest in Yahoo has not waned.

headline.main: Pursuing Yahoo, Microsoft Shows Need for Web Franchise
headline.print_headline: Pursuit of Yahoo Shows Microsoft Needs a Franchise

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Steve Lohr

abstract: Carl Icahn, the corporate raider turned activist investor, is gambling to bring Microsoft back to the bargaining table and buy Yahoo.
snippet: Carl Icahn, the corporate raider turned activist investor, is gambling to bring Microsoft back to the bargaining table and buy Yahoo.
lead_paragraph: About a month and a half ago, Carl Icahn and I went to dinner at Tse Yang, an upscale Chinese restaurant in Midtown Manhattan. Mr. Icahn, the corporate raider turned activist investor, came blustering through the dimly lit restaurant about 20 minutes late, grabbed one of the waiters  they all know him  and ordered a martini.

headline.main: A Gamble, but What if He Wins?
headline.print_headline: A Gamble, But What If He Wins?

abstract: Under its latest proposal to Yahoo, Microsoft would buy its search business and take a stake in the company, The New York Times reported Tuesday, citing people briefed on the negotiations.
lead_paragraph: Under its latest proposal to Yahoo, Microsoft would buy its search business and take a stake in the company, The New York Times reported Tuesday, citing people briefed on the negotiations.

headline.main: Details of Microsoft’s Yahoo Search Offer Emerge

abstract: At Microsoft’s advertising conference in Redmond, the elephant in the room is Yahoo — for the second year in a row.
snippet: At Microsoft’s advertising conference in Redmond, the elephant in the room is Yahoo — for the second year in a row.
lead_paragraph: When Microsoft invited its advertising customers for an annual gathering in Seattle a year ago, one of the main attractions was Terry Semel, who was then the chief executive of Yahoo. News that Microsoft and Yahoo had held discussions about a possible merger leaked before the event, and everyone was hoping to find out more.
